coded_answer.p: I am very pleased to be the winerwinner in your competition. I almost could not believe it when I received the letter you had sentsent. I have never won a prize like this. Thank you very much indeed!
I am working as a Mechanical Engineer for a well-known car company and I would like to travel in July because this the only month I can use my annual leave.
During this exciting holiday I would prefer staying in a log cabin. The reason for this is that I have got a difficulty in sleeping in tents.

When I was at the UnivercityUniversityuniversity I was very keen on basket ballbasketball and I was playingplayed infor the Univercity'sUniversity'suniversity team. In 1998 we were the champion of the First National LequeLeague. Also I am a quitequite a good swimmer. I think that is because of my long legs. So I would love to jointake part in Basketballbasketball and Swimmingswimming activities while I am at the Campcamp.
There is something I need to ask you;.

I dondon't know exactly what is California's weatherCalifornia's weather is limelike. What kind of clothes do I need to bring with me? Also, what is the currency in California and how much money do I need to take with me?
I am looking forward to your reply!

NovadaysNowadays our shopping habits seem to behave changed. I can clearly remember my childhood and our only local shop. Yes! There was only one shop in the area where I used to live until we moved to Oxford. I was really astonished by all these shopping centerscentres, like ASDA, HOMEBASE, exetc.

One day I decided to go to the shopping centercentre which is only 40 metersmetres from our house. Firstly, I could not find the entrance. I'd walked arroundaround for about 15 minutes until I found the door. I realized that I'd walked so many times in front of the entrance but the door had looked like a window. When I entered into the shopeshop I was a bit angry.
I was holding a peacepiece of paper which my mum gave to me. There were written all things I had to buyAll the things I had to buy were written on it. But no way!

I started looking for the food products writtenlisted on the paperpiece of paper but I found only the eggs, milk and bread. Nothing else. So what was all that about?! I wasted 2 hours to buybuying food which you can find in every local shop.
Later somebody told me that I had to look at the labels on the top.
